==Events==
* [[457]] &ndash; [[Leo I of the Byzantine Empire|Leo I]] becomes emperor of the [[Byzantine Empire]].
*[[1074]] &ndash; [[Pandulf IV of Benevento]] is killed battling the invading [[Normans]] at the Battle of [[Montesarchio]].
*[[1301]] &ndash; Edward of [[Caernarfon|Caernarvon]] (later King [[Edward II of England]]) becomes the first [[England|English]] [[Prince of Wales]].
*[[1497]] &ndash; The [[bonfire of the vanities]] occurs in which supporters of [[Girolamo Savonarola]] burn thousands of objects like [[cosmetics]], [[art]], and [[books]] in [[Florence]], [[Italy]].
*[[1783]] &ndash; [[American Revolutionary War]]: French and Spanish forces lift the [[Great Siege of Gibraltar]].
*[[1795]] &ndash; The [[Eleventh Amendment to the United States Constitution|11th Amendment]] to the [[United States Constitution]] is [[ratification|ratified]].
*[[1807]] &ndash; [[Napoleonic Wars]]: [[Battle of Eylau]] &ndash; [[Napoleon I of France|Napoléon]]'s [[First French Empire|French Empire]] begins fighting against [[Russia]]n and [[Prussia]]n forces of the [[Fourth Coalition]] at Eylau, [[Poland]].
*[[1812]] &ndash; The [[New Madrid Earthquake|strongest]] in a series of [[earthquake]]s strikes [[New Madrid, Missouri]].
*[[1813]] &ndash; [[Action of 7 February 1813]]: stalemate two evenly matched [[frigates]] from the [[French Navy]] and the British [[Royal Navy]], ''[[French frigate Aréthuse (1812)|Aréthuse]]'' and [[HMS Amelia (1796)|HMS ''Amelia'']].
*[[1819]] &ndash; Sir Thomas [[Stamford Raffles]] leaves [[Singapore]] after just taking it over, leaving it in the hands of [[William Farquhar]].
*[[1842]] &ndash; [[Battle of Debre Tabor]]: Ras [[Ali II of Yejju|Ali Alula]], Regent of the [[Emperor of Ethiopia]] defeats warlord Wube Haile Maryam of Semien.
*  1856  &ndash; The [[colony|colonial]] [[Parliament of Tasmania|Tasmanian Parliament]] passes the second piece of [[legislation]] (the Electoral Act of 1856) anywhere in the world providing for elections by way of a [[secret ballot]].
*[[1863]] &ndash; ''[[HMS Orpheus (1861)|HMS Orpheus]]'' sinks off the coast of [[Auckland]], [[New Zealand]], killing 189.
*[[1894]] &ndash; The [[Cripple Creek miners' strike of 1894|Cripple Creek miner's strike]], led by the [[Western Federation of Miners]], begins in [[Cripple Creek, Colorado]].
*[[1897]] &ndash; [[Greco-Turkish War (1897)|Greco-Turkish War]]: The first full-scale battle takes place when the [[Greece|Greek]] expeditionary force in [[Crete]] defeats a 4,000-strong [[Ottoman Empire|Ottoman]] force at [[Livadeia]].
*[[1898]] &ndash; [[Dreyfus affair]]: [[Émile Zola]] is brought to trial for [[libel]] for publishing ''[[J'accuse (letter)|J'Accuse]]''.
*[[1900]] &ndash; [[Second Boer War]]: [[United Kingdom of Great Britain and Ireland|British]] troops fail in their [[Battle of Vaal Krantz|third attempt]] to lift the [[Siege of Ladysmith]].
*[[1904]] &ndash; A [[Great Baltimore Fire|fire]] in [[Baltimore, Maryland]] destroys over 1,500 buildings in 30 hours.
*[[1907]] &ndash; The [[Mud March (Suffragists)|Mud March]] is the first large procession organized by the National Union of Women's Suffrage Societies (NUWSS).
*[[1935]] &ndash; The classic board game [[Monopoly (game)|Monopoly]] is invented.
*[[1940]] &ndash; The second full length animated [[Walt Disney]] film, ''[[Pinocchio (1940 film)|Pinocchio]]'', premieres.
*[[1943]] &ndash; [[World War II]]: [[Imperial Japanese Navy]] forces complete the evacuation of [[Imperial Japanese Army]] troops from [[Guadalcanal]] during [[Operation Ke]], ending Japanese attempts to retake the island from [[Allies of World War II|Allied]] forces in the [[Guadalcanal Campaign]].
*[[1944]] &ndash; World War II: In [[Anzio]], [[Italy]], [[Germany|German]] forces launch a counteroffensive during the Allied [[Operation Shingle]].
*[[1951]] &ndash; [[Korean War]]: 705 suspected communist sympathizers [[Sancheong-Hamyang massacre|are butchered]] by [[Republic of Korea Army|South Korean forces]].
*[[1962]] &ndash; The [[United States]] [[United States embargo against Cuba|bans]] all [[Cuba]]n imports and exports.
*[[1964]] &ndash; [[The Beatles]] first arrive in the United States. Their performance on ''[[The Ed Sullivan Show]]'' two days later would mark the beginning of the [[British Invasion]].
*[[1974]] &ndash; [[Grenada]] gains independence from the [[United Kingdom]].
*[[1979]] &ndash; [[Pluto]] moves inside [[Neptune]]'s orbit for the first time since either was discovered.
*[[1984]] &ndash; [[Space Shuttle program]]: [[STS-41-B]] Mission &ndash; [[Astronaut]]s [[Bruce McCandless II]] and [[Robert L. Stewart]] make the first untethered [[space walk]] using the [[Manned Maneuvering Unit]] (MMU).
*[[1986]] &ndash; Twenty-eight years of one-family rule end in [[Haiti]], when [[President]] [[Jean-Claude Duvalier]] flees the [[Caribbean]] nation.
*[[1990]] &ndash; [[Dissolution of the Soviet Union]]: The [[Central Committee]] of the [[Soviet Communist Party]] agrees to give up its monopoly on power.
*[[1991]] &ndash; [[Haiti]]'s first democratically-elected president, [[Jean-Bertrand Aristide]], is sworn in.
*[[1992]] &ndash; The [[Maastricht Treaty]] is signed, leading to the creation of the [[European Union]].
*[[1995]] &ndash; [[Ramzi Yousef]], the mastermind of the [[1993 World Trade Center bombing]], is arrested in [[Islamabad]], [[Pakistan]].
*[[1999]] &ndash; [[Crown Prince]] [[Abdullah II of Jordan|Abdullah]] becomes the King of [[Jordan]] on the death of his father, King [[Hussein of Jordan|Hussein]].
*[[2009]] &ndash; [[Black Saturday bushfires|Bushfires in Victoria]] leaves 173 dead in the worst natural disaster in Australia's history.
*[[2012]] &ndash; President [[Mohamed Nasheed]] of the [[Maldives|Republic of Maldives]] resigns, after 23 days of anti-governmental protests calling for the release of Chief Judge unlawfully arrested by the military.
*[[2013]] &ndash; At least 51 people are killed in a [[Chibombo bus crash|crash]] involving a bus and truck in [[Zambia]].
*[[2014]] &ndash; the [[2014 Winter Olympics opening ceremony|opening ceremony]] for the [[2014 Winter Olympics|Winter Olympics]] takes place in [[Sochi]], [[Russia]].
